intro: Philippia floribunda subsp. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular philippia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered with glandular dots, giving it its subspecific name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil and partial shade.
